LanguageData.CherryPicker.RestartRequired: Restoring definitions to their original values requires a game restart.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.ReloadRequired: These particular changes require reloading the save game. You do not need to restart the game.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.ThingDef.Desc: Includes things like items, buildings, equipment, plants, and animals.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.RecipeDef.Desc: Things you can craft, whether that be cooking, smithing, tailoring, etc.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.DesignationCategoryDef.Desc: These are the categories in the architect tab.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.QuestScriptDef.Desc: Quests are event types that usually involve a confirmation prompt and reward choice.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.IncidentDef.Desc: Incidents are events that just spontaneously happen.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.HediffDef.Desc: Hediffs are things that show up in the health tab, such as diseases and buffs/debufs.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.GatheringDef.Desc: Gatherings are spontaneous, internal events such as parties.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.WorkTypeDef.Desc: Lets you hide a work type from the UI.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.RaidStrategyDef.Desc: A raid strategy is what raiders do after arriving, such as immediate attack or sapping. See PawnsArrivalModeDef for their arrival method.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.MainButtonDef.Desc: These are the buttons along the bottom bar.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.AbilityDef.Desc: These are psycasts, royalty title abilities, and ideology role abilities.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.SpecialThingFilterDef.Desc: These are special filters seen in the storage and bill configuration UI.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.PawnKindDef.Desc: While a race (animal, humanoid, mech) is a ThingDef, a PawnKindDef represents a specific configuration for that race, such as their equipment.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.GenStepDef.Desc: These control the steps that game processes when generating a new map.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.InspirationDef.Desc: The type of inspirations pawns may semi-randomly pick.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.ScenarioDef.Desc: The scenarios seen on the new game setup screen.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.DesignationDef.Desc: Designations are things that show up in the build menu but are not tangible buildings, but instead orders, like for example hunt or slaughter.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.PawnsArrivalModeDef.Desc: Controls how raiders arrive to maps.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.BodyTypeDef.Desc: A pawn's graphical body types such as hulk, fat, and thin.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.FactionDef.Desc: Factions. Note you can also just remove the faction on the new world setup screen.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.PowerDef.Desc: Powers and abilities from the Vanilla Expanded mods.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.BackstoryDef.Desc: Backstories that pawns may randomly pick on generation.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.ScatterableDef.Desc: Scatterables are the non-interactable graphics that break up the monotony of the ground texture, such a big dirt splotches.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.RaidAgeRestrictionDef.Desc: These regulate the age that raiders may spawn in as.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.RulePackDef.Desc: These special naming rules, for example how a faction may name their pawns or leaders.
LanguageData.CherryPicker.DefList.Desc: This is a proprietary Cherry Picker def. Mod authors can create these defLists for their mods to create preset lists of defs that users can add/remove.
